news_header: Sanofi is executing a second tranche of its share buyback program worth up to 2 billion euros.
news_original_title: Sanofi To Repurchase EUR 2 Bln Worth Of Shares
news_text: Sanofi, a French pharmaceutical company, has announced the execution of the second tranche of its share buyback program, aiming to repurchase shares worth up to 2 billion euros. The company has signed a mandate with an investment service provider for this tranche, which will take place between February 7 and December 31. Earlier, Sanofi announced plans to buy back 5 billion euros worth of shares in 2025, with the first tranche completed recently involving a 3 billion euros off-market trade with L'Oréal S.A.
